alert.note: Alert for Lincoln (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued August 20 at 6:00PM MDT until August 21 at 1:45AM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Albuquerque NM has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in New Mexico... Rio Hondo Above Roswell affecting Chaves and Lincoln Counties. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM THIS AFTERNOON TO JUST AFTER MIDNIGHT TONIGHT... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Rio Hondo above Roswell. * WHEN...From this afternoon to just after midnight tonight. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 5:15 PM MDT Saturday the stage was 26.7 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 5:15 PM MDT Saturday was 26.7 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 26.7 feet this evening. It will then fall below flood stage this evening. - Flood stage is 26.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 26.4 feet on 06/17/1965. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Fld Observed Forecasts (6 pm MDT) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Sun Mon Tue Rio Hondo Roswell 26.0 26.7 Sat 5 pm MDT 10.5 9.3 8.5 &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/abq. The next statement will be issued late tonight around 145 AM MDT.
